text: The S.F. Controller’s Office released a batch of recommendations for reforming contracting processes within the city’s Public Works Department following a sweeping probe launched in the wake of the unfolding public corruption scandal. https://t.co/nXxf9KIs1E

text:

text:
As of Monday, 19 California counties — including Contra Costa, Santa Clara and Solano — are on a state watch list due to signs that coronavirus is spreading, potentially threatening to overload local hospitals.

text: The San Francisco Symphony paid tribute to Michael Tilson Thomas's quarter-century tenure as its orchestra's music director — online, of course. https://t.co/9B9zasH7SJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
While options for gatherings are limited in 2020, there are still plenty of possibilities to enjoy the July 4th weekend. We've compiled a list of ways to celebrate in the Bay Area — at a safe social distance or from home.

name: sfchronicle
text: Gov. Newsom signed a $202.1 billion state budget Monday that largely avoids widespread cuts to public services to close a multibillion-dollar deficit caused by the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/c1fVq31s7U

name: sfchronicle
text: A state appeals court upheld voter-approved toll increases for seven Bay Area bridges Monday, saying they were not tax increases requiring two-thirds approval and were legally passed by 55% of the voters in 2018. https://t.co/gSpASaCkfQ

text: “There are very deep scars, very deep evils that have been inflicted on the indigenous people here. I think telling the stories and owning up to them is a step in the right direction.” https://t.co/Ad96EFVTcQ

name: sfchronicle
text: A little more than a year after word spread that San Francisco’s legendary Hayes Valley restaurant, Jardiniere, would be replaced by a plant-based Italian restaurant called Baia, the new project, or at least a version of it, finally has an opening date. https://t.co/6hNvz2tgTg

name: sfchronicle
text: Don’t worry too much if you notice the iconic Ghirardelli sign vanishing over the next several weeks. The new sign will be unveiled later this summer. https://t.co/EhyBVe3FkD

name: sfchronicle
text: Hospitalization increases in the Bay Area are not as dramatic as the recent spike in cases. And deaths have not increased at all. That could be a hopeful sign... but there's a less optimistic reading of the data, too. https://t.co/CRDkIdwpyY

name: sfchronicle
text:
We got thousands of responses in our online poll for who (or what) should replace the Christopher Columbus statue at Coit Tower. The No. 1 choice got over 2x as many votes as No. 2. 

Read more about it here: https://t.co/vWQSF0m4Jm

name: sfchronicle
text: Alameda County health officer Dr. Erica Pan, a key figure in the county’s response to the coronavirus pandemic, is leaving that position for a role with the state’s health department. https://t.co/bFNkPIp1YW

name: sfchronicle
text: Unmasked patrons sipping cocktails, many seemingly oblivious to the tape on the floor marking 6 feet. “Clean your hands ya filthy animals,” read a sign. A masked DJ bobbed his head. It was a rare scene, one that is being watched — and may not last. https://t.co/AD52RzyGP1
